title: [Large-scale] Science Information Literacy Workshop Utilizing Public Health Issues

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic biology and public health concepts, basic smartphone proficiency
context.additional_context: A program cultivating information evaluation/utilization skills while solving local community health issues, using smartphone-centric collaboration tools (KakaoTalk, Naver Forms, etc.)

learning_goals: Learners can evaluate the credibility of scientific information related to local health issues (e.g., infectious disease statistics) with 80% accuracy
Learners can identify at least three credible information sources (academic papers, public data, etc.) for a given health issue
Learners can propose one community problem-solving solution using the PBL approach based on information retrieval results

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
